website_summaries.verdict: A 4-cycle, 25cc Honda engine provides power, and the convenience of taking gas only, without having to mix with oil for the engine to run.
pros: 240 rpm tine speed twice as fast as competing tillers
9-inch width, which is wide enough for clearing beds, but agile enough for tight spaces
Tines cultivate soil in depths between 2 and 10 inches
Kickstand keeps tiller steady when not in use
cons: Instructions unclear or primarily in French
Works better on pre-tilled ground for some

customer_reviews.title: Little power horse
customer_reviews.text: Works better the expected. Age and some disabilities make it harder to use a larger rear-tine tiller, this little guy tills up the soil very well. On grass covered ground the tines tangle up in grass and roots pretty fast and have to be cleared, but on established beds it does a wonderful job.
customer_reviews.author: Pat L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for use as it is designed for.
customer_reviews.text: I had an older 2 stroke Mantis I had gotten used, it was a 'tank'. After pondering to purchase a new one, I chose a 4 stroke model. I am glad I did, it has the torque and ease of operation wrapped into one unit. And it is quieter too. As in the Mantis design whether 2 stroke or 4 it DOES THE JOB, what it is designed for. For smaller applications and ease of use it's hard not to purchase a Mantis. Yeah, I know it sounds like an advertisement for the company, but, no I am just a backyard gardener like you.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiller
customer_reviews.text: As a previous Mantis owner and new owner of the Four Cycle Mantis I am well pleased with it's performance. My Mantis starts easy, runs quiet, and I am especially excited about the hand control of the tiller. I consider it a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Ross

customer_reviews.title: You don't need to be "strong" to use this.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Mantis tiller. The first was stolen when I'd had it about 10 years; the second died after more than 25 years of service. The new one is easier to use, has an option of turning just the topsoil over or digging deeply with another attachment. WOW! You don't know how much difference that makes until you have a chance to try it. All of my property is heavy with clay. I have numerous flower and vegetable gardens, the largest about 20' x 4'. I keep adding every year because it's so easy to do. I'm a woman in my late 70s.... 'Nuff said!
customer_reviews.author: shoeshines

customer_reviews.title: Assembly Instructions Missing Kickstand Install Instructions (English Insert)
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with the assembly instructions sent with this product. I already own one of these and it is an excellent product, particularly like the Honda motor. My disappointment is with the assembly instructions that were primarily in French. I am not educated in French and cannot speak or read French. The diagrams on the French instructions were helpful though. The product came with a quick start instruction page that was in English - a photocopy page that was missing instructions for installing the kickstand or more specifically WHEN to install the kickstand during the assembly process. Fortunately, I am "somewhat" handy and was able to work around the problem, but, still very disappointed with the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller
customer_reviews.text: Carrying handle looks like a leftover so make sure you get that on before screwing the handles together. The instructions could have been a lot simpler for assembly. My one hate about this machine is the oil dip stick and checking the oil level machine to check. If you over fill it you will get blow by into the air filter which drips down the blade guard. I know I did it and had to drain off the extra. Over all this tiller is fantastic! Good power, a great motor, light weight, and easy to run.
customer_reviews.author: Gray

customer_reviews.title: Another item I wish I’d bought sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Assembled the Mantis the same day I received it. Straight forward directions, with just some basic hand tools. Anyone could assemble it. After installing the provided oil and fueling it, before starting, made a visual check for any leaks. 2 pulls later, the engine fired right up. I let it run at idle speed for about 3 minutes. Took it to the garden and started to till. The Mantis handled great and after a few minutes I figured out how to better till with it. I purchased this mainly to till/weed between plants that I can’t get my big tiller to fit through. This is one item I’d wish I’d bought sooner!!!
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment. Mantis worked 1 time!
customer_reviews.text: I received this new mantis less than 3 weeks ago . I used it 1 time and it worked great. It no longer works. It’s not getting fuel and it only stays started for less than 10 seconds. I have another mantis I owned for 20 years .never had a problem. What a disappointment. I tried calling manufacturer, was on hold for 30 minutes and then disconnected.
customer_reviews.author: Scout

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this from Amazon two years ago, and since then purchased all but one accessory. The one remaining I will purchase, but it is very expensive for what you get, the two wheels that let you push to a location for use. I now carry the tiller, it’s not really heavy. I have used the (old) Troy tillers they are the best for large jobs, and this little tiller is just as good, for smaller jobs and spaces. I gave 4 stars, for cost of accessories, not the value of the construction of such.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small and light with big results for the home gardener!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised. Didn't expect the results I got from a small tiller/cultivator. It really digs in when tilling and In an established garden, you can get right in around your plants without destroying half the garden. Lots of control. Sure saves a lot of work weeding. I should have gotten this long ago. And the Honda powered engines are the best! Start-ups are real easy and they are real quiet. The dethatching and aerator attachments will be handy in the spring.
customer_reviews.author: Fraski

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after years of struggling with a Husqvarna and a Stihl. Both were hard to start and had frequent issues that made me dread using them - and that cost a lot of $ to fix. This machine is fabulous. Difference between night and day. Starts right up, great digging depth and power, and so far, problem free. I was a little surprised by the lack of wheels and the kickstand, but soon realized this is a big advantage because you don’t get rocks jamming between tines and wheels the way I did with the other machines. In a few months, I’ve used it far more than I ever did my old machines and am really pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mim

customer_reviews.title: reliable Honda motor on a tough but lightweight tiller
customer_reviews.text: We cut through some pretty tough ground to create a 25'x50' garden plot and this tiller did the job. Because it is light weight it jumped and danced on the hardpan or rocks at times, but you fairly quickly get the knack of controlling it. Maybe a bigger and heavier unit would not have jumped as much, but a heavier jumping tiller would probably beat you up more and after the initial ground breaking, this unit is easier to maneuver. I feel very comfortable with the reliability and am glad my wife insisted on this unit rather than the heavier one I was contemplating.
customer_reviews.author: John Schmit

customer_reviews.title: Mantis is a perfect little yard helper
customer_reviews.text: I got the Matis 4-cycle cultivator with lawn aerator attachment. The assembly instructions where someone convoluted, and it also didn't help that I had some missing parts (kuddos to Amazon team to supply replacement quickly). So 40 min to assemble, and 2 pulls for an initial start and this little workhorse got my 1/4 acre lot aerated (that at least $150 service). So all and all -- highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maxim Efimov

customer_reviews.title: Easy start, and a great light weight tiller!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing little tiller. It is light, but, man, does it dig in. The assembly is pretty straight forward. I watched the You Tube assembly video, and it was useful. Reading the instructions after the tiller was delivered was kind of like a refresher. The kick stand, however, is a major struggle. I am going to order a couple of the accessories, the edger and the crevice cleaner, as they seem to be most useful when keeping the house and yard up to snuff. The engine starts easily, and the tines change out with absolutely no problem. All told, this is a fine tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Experienced Listener

customer_reviews.title: Time saving and works better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! This fall I used it to aerate parts of my lawn that were dead from the big northeast drought. After slicing through the soil and spreading a mix of top soils and despite leaving most of the dead grass in place the grass sprouted like never before. I also used it to dethatch and that worked great. The fact that I no longer have to rent and lug home equipment from the big box store is worth every penny I spent on this.
customer_reviews.author: georush

customer_reviews.title: The motor ran fine. Problems are to be expected but it’s what ...
customer_reviews.text: Just received my new mantis tiller and I’m giving Mantis a 5 star even though the tines were frozen and would not turn freely. The motor ran fine. Problems are to be expected but it’s what a company does when they’re told they have a problem. Seldom experienced this type of professionalism by any company. Both chuck and John got on it immediately and they’re sending me a new lower unit. Fantastic service. Thank you. I would definitely recommend Mantis for their products.
customer_reviews.author: Tonytex

customer_reviews.title: Dirt eating son of a gun
customer_reviews.text: This powerhouse makes quick work of all your garden needs....couldn't believe how fast it digs up any type of dirt.....it digs a plant hole in about 10 seconds......In my life I was never sorry I bought the best, and this is no exception.....Update....After about 10 hours (1 year) of use it ran fine but started to make a grinding noise when the tines were engaged....called Mantis and they gave my a few places where I could take it.......Ended up at Bair's a local place.....long story short...Got my tiller back, runs great again so happy......AND no charge because Mantis stands by it's warranty Thank you......Again a dirt eating son of a gun........
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

customer_reviews.title: A gift for a friend.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tiller as a gift for a couple of friends. I am relaying their observations. They are extremely happy with this machine. It has a lot of power for such a little machine, is light to handle, easy to start and does one heck of a good job of tilling as well as weeding in their garden. I find this to be an excellent product well worth the purchase price.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and small but does the job. Dependable.
customer_reviews.text: 4 cycle makes this gas up easily. A feature worth paying for. I used this small lightweight tiller continuously for 3 days to clear ivy and blackberries from a large swath of my backyard. The ivy was very well established...20 years! So the roots clogged the tines and I needed to remove them to clean frequently. The cotter pins didn't stay put so I bought a few extras for cheap at the hardware store. It starts easily and if you're patient it's a great workhorse for such a small unit. I've used it since the ivy for my garden and several other areas. Easy starts each time. Very satisfied so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Supposedly easy to start - did not start at all.
customer_reviews.text: This rototiller was advertised as easy to start. I was unable to start it even once, having followed all the directions for proper assembly and having watched videos about the proper way to start it. I was unable to contact the company after repeated calls and waiting in the queue for over 30 minutes. Email response was estimated to be within the next 2 days, but will probably be longer since this is a holiday weekend. Since I must plant my garden this weekend, I am devastated because I was counting on it. Probably this unit is defective, but I do not have time to wait for a replacement or service. Thankfully amazon is allowing me to return it.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Glaeser

customer_reviews.title: Hard to start/ First start was the last start.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second and last Mantis tiller we will ever buy. Our 1st one lasted for about 2yr and was always hard to start wife had no luck at starting it this was a 2 cycle model. We decided to get the 4 cycle model. It was easy to put together, added the motor oil which was supplied and gas pulled the cord and it started like a champ yes but that was the last time it started spent a whole day trying to start this thing no luck. Called Amazon and had it replaced. Stay away from this brand its not worth the hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t  start after high hopes of cultivating
customer_reviews.text: After an hour assemblage ,Tiller would not engage (start), I let it sit overnight,and tried again, did not engage after a slight purr.I dragged it back into barn and accidentally gashed my leg on fathers day!Rather cheap looking, and a big disappointment to boot. Leg has a nice gash to remember it by. Sending back tomorrow!
customer_reviews.author: Ward Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Easy Start, Light, And a real BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Love it! Love it! This little tiller is just what I wanted it to be a little beast! Set up is about a half hour. Pour in the provided 4 cycle oil, add gas and I was our tilling some clay soil and rocks like a champ. It quickly broke up the hardened soil from last fall and I could then spread it out evenly by hand with a rake. The price is right, easy to assemble and runs so quiet. This was a Mother’s day gift, but Dad will be using it most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Jon D

customer_reviews.title: never worked out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Tiller never worked day one. Called the 800 number service department and they were no help. Told me to take it to another town 50 miles away. What a joke. Tines were froze up and would not move gear housing was never properly installed Called around myself and found a warranty service department 3 miles away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller, works better than I thought it would.
customer_reviews.text: Tiller arrived mostly assembled, only had to install the handlebars assembly. Don't forget to add the engine oil! Mine came with a bottle of oil in the package. Engine has plenty of power, and we have used it quite a bit in our hard clay soil with no issues. It takes a few passes on harder soil to dig in, but eventually you can easily dig down 8-9 inches. The tiller is light and easy to work with. Engine seems to start up well every time, and should be reliable since it is a Honda.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Scott

customer_reviews.title: Does Much More than Just a Garden!
customer_reviews.text: I had the Mantis electric tiller for about 7 yrs. I did everything with that little baby. Tilling, Dethaching, Aeroating, Edging and even using the crevice tool for between the cracks of the sidewalk. The cord was a bid of a pain, but doable. I recently switched to all gas equipment, so I had to get the 4-cycle Mantis. Boy this little guy is a BEAST! So much more powerful than the electric one, and good reason. My yard isn't giant, but I use all the accessories, well, most of them now for my lawn. Get this thing to do it all!
customer_reviews.author: TRich

customer_reviews.title: Great little tiller!
customer_reviews.text: Not easy to install at all and found an error in the starting instructions to which I contacted the company and they were very nice to speak with. This thing really gets after it. I'm surprised at how effective it is to be so small. Definitely install the kickstand despite the frustration you may experience in doing so, it's nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling D Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Mantis you Rock!
customer_reviews.text: Little Hoss , easy assembly, started right up. If you till virgin ground you will have to clean tines many times. I got the 4 cycle and it starts every time. I"m 73 yrs old and my bigger tiller is a man killer, this one fits the bill really like it, only thing most un mechanical types won't do and manual doesn't address, grease the tine shaft, makes taking me off easier.
customer_reviews.author: TBRAD

customer_reviews.title: Tough !
customer_reviews.text: This machine is an absolute animal !, ..... my neighbor bought an earthquake brand, but after using his, ... well .... there's simply no comparison. I've put this unit into some really tough ground, even my river rock drive, and it still wants more !, ..... Tines are easily removable for cleaning, ... starts first pull every time, ... and surprizing quite. I always look forward to operating it ,,,,,, need more tasks ! Keep it clean
customer_reviews.author: AWK

customer_reviews.title: Love my Mantis
customer_reviews.text: Did my due diligence and came down to several factors. Schiller is a tiller mfg from PA and the Honda 4 stroke is easy, quiet and durable. Assembly out of the box was not the clearest but I quickly found a youtube video and it was a piece of cake after seeing someone else assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Recognize Me

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Little Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I initially rented one of these units from Home Depot and found it so useful I decided to buy one to keep around the house for my yard projects. This tiller tears up the dirt like a larger unit would but it is so light and easy to carry around. I've used a variety of different tillers and this one is by far the best and easy on your back and arms; best results are walking backwards pulling the unit with you. ..Can't complain at all
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Camp

customer_reviews.title: Tiller
customer_reviews.text: I rolled a garden with a foot of grass growing in it. The tiller clogs and stops turning. Pull the tines off and clean it out. I quit putting the pins in to save time the next Tim. I cleaned it 1/2 a dozen times. After all the tall grass was gone it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Nowactive

customer_reviews.title: I am exceedingly happy with the performance of this tiller and also happy ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2-cycle Mantis tiller over 30 years old and it has been relatively trouble free and I replaced it with this 4-cycle Mantis. I have used this tiller to dig up my raised bed garden as well as dig up an area about 120 square feet to plant glass. I am exceedingly happy with the performance of this tiller and also happy that I don't have to use a fuel mixture.
customer_reviews.author: Fred41Mag

customer_reviews.title: Awesome-ness
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! Assembled quickly. Started on third or fourth pull. Kicked ass on my garden. All weeds are gone and ready for planting. All kinds of power. Wonderful so far! I also bought the dethatching and aerating combo attachments and figured I’d dethatch. Once again, awesome! I haven’t tried the aerator yet. But I can’t wait. Five stars for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Scott DeMink

customer_reviews.title: High Quality - perfect tool for small gardens and beds
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple in the past (sold them due to moves, etc.), and loved every one. This time I sprung for the 4-cycle engine and couldn't be happier. It's perfect for small gardens and flower beds, making light work of weeds, aerating the soil, and keeping things nice and "soft/workable". Starts very easily and easy to handle. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Hmmm.  First 8 years with original one happy - this one could not shut off after 3 uses 🤨
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Mantis before - for years - all things come to an end... this one came, easy to assemble. After 2 uses it would not shut off unless you applied full choke. It is obviously under warranty so it is at ‘the shop’ now. They responded immediately and gave us dealer names where we are. P S the ‘shop’ is 20 miles from where we live😏
customer_reviews.author: daisy2do

customer_reviews.title: Such a beast! Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some reviews stating that you still need a larger tiller to break ground for a garden. I disagree. This animal ripped through 2,000 sq. ft. of never broken, well traveled earth with no hesitation. Yes, you have to work a little and it takes a little longer, but I managed to complete it in one afternoon. Tilled and cultivated. Easy to assemble. Stupid easy to start, and impressively quiet. Very happy with this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M.

customer_reviews.title: Love Mantis
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Mantis tiller in the last 25 years. Simply the best if you are into your yard. Went with the 4 cycle this time for easy of use and power. Great choice for you too. Yes the shortcoming is the weeds and things get caught in the tines. Not sure how to ever prevent this? Its the very best tool for any home owner!
customer_reviews.author: Al O

customer_reviews.title: New 4 Cycle Mantis Cultivator is Worth Every Penny !!
customer_reviews.text: After owning a 2 cycle Mantis for 20 years, I purchased a new 4 cycle unit. What an improvement. From the handle gripS to the kick stand, it is light years above my old unit. No more mixing gas, easy starting, better control, ease of operation, all make this unit a great addition to my gardening experience. The kickstand is a very nice feature, which eliminates trying to balance it, while filling the tank with gas. I can not be more pleased with this unit than I am. I have used it three times and it has exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.author: John Driver

customer_reviews.title: You won't believe it
customer_reviews.text: So...be warned - it will take some practice to get the results you want but once you master this little beast you'll wonder how the heck you ever lived without this little tiller. It's the Amateur Gardeners best friend.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Passehl

customer_reviews.title: Cultivates with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Although the 1st one we ordered had an important piece missing. The return/replacement was very easy. The new one has worked great. Bought an older home with a yard full of berry bushes. This has sliced through the roots nicely. Don't forget to clean between the blades when cutting through rough stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Resort Lady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tiller/cultivator!
customer_reviews.text: After easy assembly it started right up on the first pull. It was so smooth and quiet, I wasn't sure it had started! It has performed very nicely every time I have used it and I am impressed with the power and performance. And it is a big bonus not to mix gas. Admittedly, I don't get along well with 2 cycle engines anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick McCurry

customer_reviews.title: It tills well.
customer_reviews.text: This little tiller is amazing. Easy to carry to work area or for storage. Very easy to maneuver around plants/rows in garden. Starts quickly. The only (and this is nitpicking) drawback is it runs pretty loud at full throttle. Not enough for a star removal. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Joe Brown

customer_reviews.title: A toy that is a powerful tool!
customer_reviews.text: Have been doing home gardening for many years and have relied on a Troy-Bilt Horse . I now wished I bought a Mantis sooner. It allows me to work in tight places where the big tiller could not. Assembly was very easy and simple. The engine started on the first pull and continues to perform well (Honda 4-cycle). Our SW Missouri soil is very rocky but it's able to handle it. On a few occasions, rocks around an inch diameter gets stuck between the inner blades and the casing. and the tiller stops turning.
customer_reviews.author: M. Canlas

customer_reviews.title: Compact machine to do a big job
customer_reviews.text: Received Mantis the day after ordering with Prime. Great machine. Assembly was easy but follow the directions. Requires tightening tools, wrench/socket wrench, not included but usually in your tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my ten year old craftsmen tiller with this one! Nice to not have to mix gas with oil on this model 7940 you cannot go wrong buying a Mantis tiller they are simply the best for getting into tight spaces and pulverizing dirt to very fine granules...this works better than my old heavier craftsman. Thank you Amazon and Mantis :)
customer_reviews.author: Slyman :)

customer_reviews.title: Fragile Junk
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had this thing for 6 months, the kick stand broke off, the handles are bending, and god love you if you have an easier way to clean out vines or roots than to use pliers and a screw driver. For as much as this thing cost you'd think it would be more robust. I'm going to seek a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Naime Penn

customer_reviews.title: Directions regarding the fuel is not accurate. Tiller does take straight gas
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I had to write this update to correct my error... looks like I mistook a "spark" arrestor for where I thought the spark plug was missing... I still am not clear if this engine can run on straight gasoline or a gas/oil mix. Just tried the tiller works fantastic, spot tilling my lawn, ridding weeds, bare areas.. very solid design, engine is very quiet and yes, NO OIL MIX is needed for this tiller, very nice!
customer_reviews.author: lovtoskivt

customer_reviews.title: Using it commercially
customer_reviews.text: Love this machine so far. Im using it with the dethatcher attachment commercially where i don't want to lift heavy machine upstairs to yards. Works so good ive been leaving heavy one home. I like the versatility of it as a tiller on its own, prepped a few small sod jobs with aerator attachment then straight tiller. It will pull you like other machines but its expected. Went with the Honda 4stroke, should last a long time
customer_reviews.author: AP10304

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little machine but very powerful and easy to use with assortment of useful attachments!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful and light. Instructions to assemble are terrible but I rarely use instructions for simple setup. Honda engine works great and many attachments are available. I already used the edger and dethatcher however didn’t get a chance to use the aerator yet or the tiller. They both worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: The machine was easy to assemble and started easily
customer_reviews.text: I decided to finally replace my finicky, hard to start and keep running, 1980's era 2-cycle Mantis Tiller with their 4-cycle model. The machine was easy to assemble and started easily. The Honda engine is powerful and the tiller works well. I would advise wearing hearing protection while operating, since the engine can be quite loud when operating at full speed. A happy bonus was that my edging blade from my previous tiller worked on the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far!
customer_reviews.text: Read instructions before you assemble and don’t wreck the box or assembly will be hard. 1st season it has worked well. Starts easy tills well. Light weight. Only cons are it’s loud and it’s cold blooded until it warms up. I start it and let it run for a couple minutes while I do other stuff otherwise it dies when you throttle it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: surprised
customer_reviews.text: While it's difficult to start due to its light weight, once it starts it tears into the ground like a badger. Really shreds the soil well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Zabloski

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use. I’m 67 year old woman and I can till my own vegetable gardens. Very manageable and efficient. My veggie garden is huge so it takes me two days but I get it done by myself with this little tiller
customer_reviews.author: Pam Sproul

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great purchase, the machine starts easy and runs better ...
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great purchase, the machine starts easy and runs better than I would have anticipated. I can work the tiller thru some pretty firm soil and it break up the material pretty fine. My wife uses it for the garden all by herself and feels very comfortable using it. I would definitely recommend purchasing over a 2 cycle machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Little Giant
customer_reviews.text: This little four stroke tiller is an animal. Plenty of power and easy to start and use. I just want to say that ive read a lot of reviews and folks have given it bad ratings because it wasnt breaking up they're hard ground or acting as a roto tiller. This is not a roto tiller! It is a cultivator. It will not break up hard ground very well. What it does do well is re cutivate and weed in and around beds. The Honda engine is very reliable. Always use True-fuel or something similar in small long term storage engines and youll never have an issue starting and storing
customer_reviews.author: Matheu

customer_reviews.title: I thought it was pretty easy to put together and looks good
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was pretty easy to put together and looks good. haven't run it yet. But so far looks good!!
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: Like the features on the new one better
customer_reviews.text: 2nd machine, 1st one lasted long time and was rebuilt once but just got tired, so had to be replaced. Like the features on the new one better. Thanks, I work it hard.
customer_reviews.author: michael frantz

customer_reviews.title: This is a little workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: This is a little workhorse! It is easy to assemble and light enough to carry around to where you need it. After breaking my back with a large tiller, this is wonderful. In "till" mode it digs deep if you do the back and forth pattern suggested. In "cultivator" mode it does just enough digging, and is easy to move around between plants. I was able to till my garden boxes as well!! It has definitely extended my gardening years ahead. I love this little machine!!
customer_reviews.author: B Cilluffo

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the 4-cycle Mantis over 24" 5-horse front tine.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle. Powerful concentration and versatile. Allows use in narrow areas. Simple to lift to work raised beds. More useful than 24" wide front-tine 5-horse tiller in terms of digging down, albeit more of the narrower passes are needed to cover similar area but without the repeated passes on the same dirt. Walking backwards means lots of turning to check clear path, but is doable. The 4-cycle engine is easy to start and strong. Tines are simple to remove to clear wound roots. Quite pleased with this model. Not sure about less-powerful models for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Kelvie

customer_reviews.title: brand new Received it took to garden next day broke it in 45 min took to repair shop
customer_reviews.text: Picked it up today for a cost of 128.82. first, told the engine as shipped was put on backwards. Next, because of that the cable broke that handles propulsion then the carburetor had to be replaced, because of the engine problem oil flowed into it. Assembly because of the engine was difficult (a very tight fit on the cable which broke) Good luck, I will try it tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: nigel h.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t go it alone!
customer_reviews.text: Really goes fast! Great for tilling but not good in long grass or dried tall weeds. Definitely a tiller for owed dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie L-D

customer_reviews.title: Wowowow.  Wow.
customer_reviews.text: Came without tines. I am not joking. I will call support Monday - I will update this either way. Without tines, the unit is useless. Update - Mantis sent new tines immediately when notified. It it just a great tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Tungate

customer_reviews.title: Great small garden tiller
customer_reviews.text: This is great tiller for small gardens, It took about 30min to fully assemble with easy instructions.
customer_reviews.author: joel jones

customer_reviews.title: Is an excellent light tiller.
customer_reviews.text: Tiller made short work of my garden. Save me a lot of backbreaking work. Starts good and performed with plenty of power. I like I don't have to mix gas with oil. Assembly of the unit wasn't too bad. Was delivered fast and in good shape. Includes engine oil.
customer_reviews.author: Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle plows like mule
customer_reviews.text: My heavy duty tiller died after many years of use on the farm. Since I am now doing raised beds I needed something easy to handle I was amazed how this tiller can handle breaking ground with ease. Sure beats digging by hand
customer_reviews.author: Russell J. Christie

customer_reviews.title: Good Machine for Small, Level Spaces
customer_reviews.text: Nice little machine for small, level spaces; Easy to carry. But it’s not fun/easy walking backward on unlevel terrain, and tilling compacted clay soil requires a lot of work and control on the user’s part.
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Jowers

customer_reviews.title: Quality Tool...
customer_reviews.text: This Tool Will Serve Your Every Need as Far As Turning The Soil in Your Garden Or Starting A New One, Amazing Tool
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine!
customer_reviews.text: Really useful piece of equipment. Does the job well. Powerful for its size. Put it through quite the test with our cement-like rocky soil and the Mantis tore through it in no time. It can bounce around a lot on the hard soil, so the operator needs to have some strong arms to control it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Allen

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This small tiller/cultivator is so versatile. I have a small garden that I tilled and I have also used it to dig deep holes when needed. It chews up the hard ground and makes it east to use a shovel in hard ground. I used it for landscaping too, digging out the side of a hill to put up a retaining wall and level out part of my yard. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: We needed something that would till up our small gardens and this did the job very well! Very easy to put together, started with only one or two pulls and it really dug down into the dirt. Fairly light weight so even I handled it! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: This is a top notch machine.
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with the performance of this machine. I accomplished in a hour more than I would have done in a full day with excellent results. The soil just ended up perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Luis A.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Light enough that I can handle; strong enough to get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small, easy to put into my car
customer_reviews.text: happy with it, happy amazon let me make payments rather than paying the full price up front. works well, doesn't burn gas too fast. goes deep. pretty happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for it’s size.
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews, I was marginally concerned about tilling in ground with lots of roots, but I was pleasantly surprised. It handled lots of different soil types with ease. I’m only a single tank of gas in, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first tiller, and have owned a previous 2-cycle Mantis. Love this one. Plenty of power and easy to maneuver. The 4-cycle makes it A LOT more reliable to get started and run well. Once you get one of these, you will never live without one. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: vicente juan md

customer_reviews.title: Tough little tiller
customer_reviews.text: Assembly is a bit of a pain (mounting the handles so they are even takes some trial and error) but the power of this little tiller is amazing. It's highly capable - you can easily till down 1 foot of depth and it weighs almost nothing. 4/5 stars for the handle assembly.
customer_reviews.author: adeptus_culinarious

customer_reviews.title: A Mantis that really works.
customer_reviews.text: Started the first time (after I turned on the ignition switch). 4-cycle Honda - what an improvement over the other Mantis's (Manti?) I have worn out. I am slowly replacing all tow-cycle tools. Don't know what to do about the chain saw. Are there any 4-cycle chain saws?
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: quite the little beast
customer_reviews.text: powerful for its size. Make short work on clay soil. Great and versatile machine. Would recommend to anyone, especially a senior citizen such as myself. Have used a Troybilt Horse tiller for over 30 years and the Mantis is easier to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Green

customer_reviews.title: This 4 cycle model is a winner.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the 2cycle mantis for many years and replaced it with the 4 cycle version. This one is quieter and somewhat easier to handle and no more mixing the gas and oil. The kickstand and controls are great. The fact that all my original accessories fit the new model is a real benefit.
customer_reviews.author: The human backhoe

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: First time that I finally got to use the product and the throttle control on the engine side broke. It was made of plastic and didn't hold up to typical tilling
customer_reviews.author: Derick

customer_reviews.title: A real workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This has got a workout this last year . Fills up rocks with clay. We have nice dirt under grass and a beautiful flower bed now !
customer_reviews.author: Kathy W

customer_reviews.title: Mantis 4 cycle
customer_reviews.text: a replacement for a 20 year old 2 cycle. Starts easily and is quiet. It does the job and is easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Linder

customer_reviews.title: This thing was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Why did I wait so long? This thing was easy to assemble, with few tools. No mixing oil is a huge plus for me. I have never had a piece of equipment start so easily from the start. I was able to till my garden in about the time it took me with a large machine. It has plenty of power and is lightweight. I also found it was very easy to control the tiller, even at full speed. This should be a big help during the season. Bottom line, I think the premium is worth it, and would recommend this to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start
customer_reviews.text: For such a light weight tiller this machine works coarse soil into a fine consistency to the proper depth while being very easy to carry between areas of our yard. Needless to say, the Honda engine is easy to start every time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The new model has great enhancements
customer_reviews.text: We had an old Mantis and the newer model has some nice improvements that has improved use. Easy to assembly, easy to start a good little workhorse
customer_reviews.author: William E. Sabourin

customer_reviews.title: not for untilled ground
customer_reviews.text: just bounces on top of the ground while grass attaches to the tines. you need to have the ground tilled first by a bigger machine. makes a good wall hanger
customer_reviews.author: Robert Layne

customer_reviews.title: The more I use this little powerhouse, the more ...
customer_reviews.text: The more I use this little powerhouse, the more impressed I am with it. I bought it to turn over a couple of raised flower beds thinking that it would be too small and anemic to do much else, but boy was I ever wrong. I've alreadyused it to till two large flowerbeds that hadn't been touched for over 10 years, and it didn't even blink at the rock hard clay laden soil. Then I used it to dig holes to plant two trees. I wish I had bought one of these years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little machine
customer_reviews.text: Used this tiller on my rocky, root covered and hard North East front yard. Great little machine. Turned over the hard soil so that I could plant a new lawn. Worked great. Now I have a green lawn in the front yard thanks to my Mantis and without breaking my back.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My second one first was a 2 cycle and lasted 20 years. Accessories from the first fit this one and 4 cycle so no more mixing gas and oil.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome in red clay.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tiller. New home needed a lot of work. This thing is a beast on red clay. Awesome for digging holes to plant trees and prepare flower beds on tough SC red clay.
customer_reviews.author: SandyinSC

customer_reviews.title: Ordered for hubby
customer_reviews.text: This has been a wonderful addition to our gardening!!! Easy to move, tills wonderfully. Husband wasn't sure when I told him it was coming, but it is so much easier on his back and does a great job! He is happy and I am too!
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase. Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This small tiller does the work of most large ones. This was a great purchase. Easy to assemble, light and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Lovelady

customer_reviews.title: This is one tough and powerful little machine!
customer_reviews.text: Pound for pound, there no comparison between the Mantis and other gasoline tillers. This is the first year of our garden and the soil is mostly clay with some roots and rocks remaining. The Mantis Tiller breaks down the soil quickly and effectively exposing unseen rocks for removal. I was amazed by the power of this little machine and the ease in operation. In my opinion, Mantis can’t be beaten for its light weight maneuverability, reliability, and effectiveness. My only regret is that I did not purchase one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Eddings

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Mantis tiller. It is so nice and has a throttle and very easy to use. Don't know how I managed without it before. Honda motor starts with one pull. nice.
customer_reviews.author: ljack5009

customer_reviews.title: tiller
customer_reviews.text: sweet little machine has plenty of power and it works great i have used a few of these and this one is best by far!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Works Awesome!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing works amazing. Assembled it today and used it for my spring tilling. This made very quick work of my 40’x40’ garden. It chewed through everything in no time flat, leaving a soft fluffy soil to work in. Highly recommend it. Some assembly required so leave 30-60 minutes till you’re ready to use it. But not all that bad. A very excellent machine.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Easy to assemble. Easy to start. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Shafer

customer_reviews.title: Mantis 7940 4-Cycle Tiller Cultivator Powered by Honda
customer_reviews.text: The Mantis 7940 4-Cycle Tiller Cultivator Powered by Honda was a perfect fit for my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Flores III

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product forget the 2 cycle, I owned one impossible to start, after assembly started on second pull, it also has lots more power the the 2 cycle, the extra cost is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JMaC

product_meta.title: Schiller Grounds Care 7940 4-Cycle Gas Powered Cultivator, red
product_meta.description: Get to the fun part of gardening faster and easier than you ever dreamed possible! Easy to start, quiet and with no fuel mixing required, the Mantis 4-cycle Plus Tiller weighs only 24 pounds. It's one of the lightest small tillers you can buy. Featuring a premium 4-cycle engine powered by Honda, this lightweight powerhouse is tough enough to till through sod and compacted dirt, but is easy to carry, easy to start and easy to use. Forget old-time tillers - this work-saver has soft, sure-grip handles that are ergonomically flared for fatigue-free operation. Infinite speed means you can power your tiller up when you need to, or work more gently if the situation requires. Digging by hand or renting a giant, hard-to-handle behemoth tiller is no fun! Live your Dream Garden! The Mantis Tiller takes on heavyweight projects like busting established sod and compacted dirt or digging a planting hole with ease. The unique, curvy tines (blades) can till a full 10 inches deep. Then with a simple flip of the tines, you can precision-weed around delicate plants and seedlings! This is a gardening tool you'll use all season long! Don't hold back! Put this tiller through most any challenge! The Mantis Tiller is the tool you've been waiting for - the missing link to the greenhouse quality soil every successful garden needs. Convenient, Versatile, and Durable the Mantis Tiller/Cultivator features folding handle bars which make it convenient to store in a garage or tool shed. An innovative transmission design is what allows such a lightweight tool to provide heavyweight performance. Plus every tiller that comes out of our Southampton, PA facility is built with the lifetime service of the user in mind. Get the garden of your dreams. You can do it!
feature_bullets: Powerful Honda 4-cycle (gas only, no fuel mix required) 25cc engine spins the tines twice as fast as other tillers
Weighs just 24 pounds. Tine speed up to 240 rpm
Finger controlled throttle for infinite speed control and ease of operation
The compact 9 inch width allows the tiller to get into tight spaces around your yard that larger tillers cannot get to.
Includes handy kickstand for steady placement when not in-use and for easy fueling
Folds for easy transport and storage
The unique, curvy tines can be used to till down 10 inches deep. Or, simply turn the tines around to shallow cultivate the top 2 to 3 inches of soil.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars587 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
